items.content_html:
The visual effect of this is extra gray space after the code.

Based on mechanical replacement of ' ' with ' ' and
manually vetting each change.
items.title: Fix space before in Learn pages

items.content_html:
Checklist — To help your pull request get merged faster, please do the following:

    • Provide a summary of your changes — say what problem you are fixing, what files are changed, and what you've done. This doesn't need to be hugely detailed, as we can see exact changes in the "Files changed" tab.
      This pull request changes an article so that it uses "main" instead of "master"

The page this pull request updates if we merge it is https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Web_Audio_API/Simple_synth.
items.title: use "main" instead of "master" in simple synth doc

items.content_html:
computedName and computedRole were originally in
https://wicg.github.io/aom/spec/ but since removed.

element.pseudo() surprisingly isn't in Gecko, despite CSSPseudoElement
being behind a pref:
https://github.com/mozilla/gecko-dev/blob/be906232eedb22c064b78f3806b38964c04f1fbc/dom/webidl/CSSPseudoElement.webidl#L13

Also remove undoManager from Document, which also hasn't shipped,
although it is behind a flag (setting) in WebKit:
https://trac.webkit.org/browser/webkit/trunk/Source/WebCore/dom/DocumentUndoMananger.idl?rev=266926
items.title: Remove parts of Element not implemented anywhere (and not in BCD)

items.content_html: Experimenting.
items.title: core.quotePath=false so that get-diff-action can cope with non-ascii file paths

items.content_html: Fixed the flaws. In particular, the <pre> tag there had the brush: set to cssline-numbers which is missing a space because there is syntax highlighter called cssline-numbers.
items.title: fix bad brush class on css/@media/-webkit-transition

items.content_html:
old destination just tells the user to go to the location that this update contains.

items.title: bypass interstitial page in simple build link

items.content_html:
The markerUnits attribute defines the coordinate system for the markerWidth and markerHeight attributes, not markerWidth and markerUnits as is currently reflected in the docs. This commit changes the docs to match the SVG 1.1 and SVG 2 specs.

items.title: Fix incorrect references in markerUnits docs

items.content_html:
We ought to mention how to handle multiple checkboxes in MDN's article: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/Forms/Basic_native_form_controls

I've also added an example.

As discussed in this PR on learning-area repository.
items.title: Mention how to handle related checkbox items

items.content_html:
The IDL for childElementCount is this:

interface mixin ParentNode {
  readonly attribute unsigned long childElementCount;
};

Document includes ParentNode;
DocumentFragment includes ParentNode;
Element includes ParentNode;

Therefore we need these pages (created in this PR):
http://localhost:3000/en-US/docs/Web/API/Document/childElementCount
http://localhost:3000/en-US/docs/Web/API/DocumentFragment/childElementCount
http://localhost:3000/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/childElementCount

Currently existing is: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ParentNode/childElementCount
(I made that a redirect to http://localhost:3000/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/childElementCount which is the oldest/original API.)

This note was fun (I removed it). ElementTraversal seems to be the old mixin here. Neither ElementTraversal nor ParentNode are really interesting to readers as the note points out.

This property was initially defined in the ElementTraversal pure interface. As this interface contained two distinct set of properties, one aimed at Node that have children, one at those that are children, they have been moved into two separate pure interfaces, ParentNode and ChildNode. In this case, childElementCount moved to ParentNode. This is a fairly technical change that shouldn't affect compatibility.
items.title: Demix ParentNode.childElementCount

items.content_html: The only two left outside Web/CSS and Web/SVG that previously looked internal but are actually external.
items.title: fix straggler external image flaws

items.content_html: Turns out, there are a couple more fixable flaw external images. The legacy once that initially looked like they were local.
items.title: fix external image flaws in Web/SVG

items.content_html: Turns out, there are a couple more fixable flaw external images. The legacy once that initially looked like they were local.
items.title: fix external (/@api/deki) image flaws in Web/CSS

items.content_html:
This PR adds a "Formal Definition" heading above cssinfo in the margin web/css doc.

I noticed this heading on other property docs and it appeared to be missing here.

Let me know if this is buttery or not.

Love MDN!!! Thanks!!!

items.content_html:
Fixes a typo in https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-linejoin#miter-clip and https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-linejoin#arcs

below vs bellow

I checked to make sure this wasn't an English vs American spelling - and am pretty certain it's just a mistake.

items.content_html:
There are two more instances of jsref that I look suspicious, but I am not sure what to do about:

files/en-us/web/api/arraybufferview/index.html
11:<p>{{JSRef("Global_Objects", "TypedArray", "Int8Array,Uint8Array,Uint8ClampedArray,Int16Array,Uint16Array,Int32Array,Uint32Array,Float32Array,Float64Array")}}</p>

files/en-us/web/api/buffersource/index.html
11:<div>{{JSRef("Global_Objects", "ArrayBuffer")}}</div>
items.title: Replace broken jsref with jsxref

items.content_html: Another color functional notation: https://drafts.csswg.org/css-color/#device-cmyk
items.title: adds device-cmyk() CSS notation

items.content_html: Fixes a typo in the examples (https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/ariaKeyShortcuts#examples). The example had the wrong aria attribute aria-disabled mentioned and not aria-keyshortcuts.
items.title: Fixed typo for wrong aria attribute in example

items.content_html:
Fixes #3266

Making this more accurate but also removing the text which mentions horizontal, vertical etc. given that it is more correctly block and inline.
items.title: small fix to text

items.content_html:
Fixes #3308

This removes the truncation of the checkbox "value" example, and also does some tidying of the note boxes.

@chrisdavidmills The issue poster correctly notes that since the value is not displayed client side, the intereactive example shown is pointless. My leaning would be to either remove it, or perhaps to add a note where indicated "Note that the value is not shown client side, so does not affect rendering in the example above". Thoughts?
items.title: Remove truncation of input element value example

items.content_html:
Fixes #3298

Google Cloud is another option/peer or azure, Amazon etc, so added that.
Also fixed up note boxes to use standard notecard classes.
items.title: Express: GoogleCloud hosting option
